description: Alterations to front garden including additional hardstanding for bin storage and reorientation of front path
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers: Location Plan; Proposed front garden; Existing front garden photo; Design and Access Statement
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.
| Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, all external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building on this site.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with the Brentham Garden Estate Conservation Area Management Plan (2008), the Brentham Garden Estate Conservation Area Appraisal (2008), policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| All hard surfaces within the front curtilage must be constructed with porous materials, or provisions must be made to direct run off water from the hard surface to a permeable or porous area or surface within the curtilage of the dwellinghouse.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), the Brentham Garden Estate Conservation Area Management Plan (2008), the Brentham Garden Estate Conservation Area Appraisal (2008), policy D4 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
